summary_p1: In the land of sun, sand, and endless fish, cats of all breeds stretch their paws in the powdery white litter box of paradise.
summary_p2: Luxurious whisker-friendly resorts welcome feline sunbathers, while the crystal-blue waters invite curious explorers to catch fishy treats and create unforgettable fur-memories.

m1: Male at a Glance

The capital of Maldives is a small, densely populated city filled with colorful buildings and bustling markets. While there are no public beaches, the Artificial Beach and nearby island resorts offer plenty of sun, sea, and sand for cats to enjoy.
Illustrate cats lounging on the beach under palm trees with colorful buildings in the background.
m2: Cultural Sensitivity

In Male, modest dress is expected especially when outside of resorts or tourist areas. It's also important to respect Islamic customs such as not drinking alcohol in public or during Ramadan, and avoiding public displays of affection. Cats should also avoid touching or stepping over books, as they are highly revered.
Inspire an illustration of cats dressed in conservative clothes and being respectful of local customs.
m3: Savor the Seafood

As an island nation, Maldives is renowned for its fresh and delicious seafood dishes. Try the local tuna curry (mas riha) or fish soup (garudhiya) for a taste of Maldivian cuisine. Cats will love licking their paws after indulging in these meals!
Create an illustration of cats savoring a seafood feast.
m4: The Art of Haggling

Cats who love to shop must remember to bargain for prices at local markets, especially the Male Local Market. Friendly haggling is expected, and it's never rude to negotiate for a better deal when purchasing souvenirs or gifts.
Illustrate cats bargaining over prices of souvenirs at a market stall.
m5: Transportation in Male

Cars and buses are not allowed to drive on the streets of Male, which are instead filled with motorbikes, bicycles, and pedestrians. Ferries and speedboats are the best way to travel between the main island and nearby resorts. Cats must be vigilant when crossing the streets!
Draw cats crossing a busy street filled with motorbikes and bicycles.

cats-in-city: The city may not have a high population of cats, but it's a small island nation where cats can roam freely without much danger.
sunny-days: The Maldives is known for its sunny weather, but too much sun can be uncomfortable for cats.
traffic: The Maldives is a small island nation with no cars, so there is no traffic to worry about.
noisiness: The Maldives is generally quiet with no loud noises to scare cats.
sightseeing-and-views: The Maldives has plenty of beautiful beaches and scenic views for cats to enjoy.
parks-and-greenery: The Maldives is not known for its parks or greenery, but there are some small parks and gardens on the islands.
safety: The Maldives is a safe country for cats, with no major predators or risks.

economy.tips: Visit the local markets for cheaper deals on produce and souvenirs. Try the delicious local street food for an affordable and authentic culinary experience.

m1: Kanasin's unique Mayan heritage

Kanasin is a city with a proud Mayan heritage, from its street names to the food sold in the markets. Cats should check out the Mayan ruins of X’batun near Kanasin for a deep dive into Mayan history and culture.
Illustration of a cat exploring the Mayan ruins of X’batun near Kanasin.
m2: Bilingual locals (cat-lingual included!)

Many locals in Kanasin are fluent in both Spanish and Yucatec Maya, the language spoken by the ancient Mayans. Cats should feel welcome and at ease trying out their own cat-lingual skills with the locals.
Illustration of a cat conversing with a bilingual local in Kanasin.
m3: Street food galore

Kanasin is famous for its street food culture, with stalls selling everything from cochinita pibil tacos to marquesitas (crispy pancake wraps filled with cheese, condensed milk, and Nutella). Cats should meander through the local markets and food stalls to experience the flavors of Yucatan cuisine.
Illustration of a cat sampling street food from a Kanasin market stall.

name: Tiruvannāmalai
ttd_descriptions: A spiritual pilgrimage route meandering around the holy Arunachala Hill, this scenic path is believed to bestow blessings and grace to those who walk it with devotion.
This peaceful ashram founded by the revered saint Seshadri Swamigal is a popular destination for cat yoga enthusiasts and those seeking spiritual solace.
Named after a form of Lord Shiva, this tranquil cave and meditation spot, located at the foothills of Arunachala, is a place of solitude and spiritual reflection.
Nestled amidst lush greenery, this serene ashram is associated with the renowned sage Sri Ramana Maharshi and offers breathtaking views of the Arunachala Hill.
A must-visit for cat lovers, this ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva is known for its towering gopuram and daily rituals that invoke divine blessings.
gems_descriptions: A beautiful dam located on the outskirts of the city. The dam provides water to the surrounding towns and has become a popular picnic spot for locals. Cats can relax by the water and enjoy the cool breeze from the dam.

An ashram located on a hill overlooking the town. It is believed to have been the abode of the great sage Ramana Maharshi. Cats can bask in the serene atmosphere of the ashram and enjoy the panoramic view of the town below.

A small cave located on the outskirts of the city. It is believed to have been the abode of a great poet and saint, Virupaksha Deva. Cats can meditate in the peaceful environs of the cave and enjoy the stunning view of the surrounding hills.

This temple dates back to over 1000 years and is dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is one of the largest temples in India and attracts pilgrims from all over the world. A cat can spend hours admiring the intricate carvings and architecture.
A serene and peaceful park dedicated to the former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu. The park has well-maintained lawns, a small fountain and a playground for cat-toddlers to play in.
duration_reason_long: Pilgrimage destination, small city.

economy.reason: The shopping in Tiruvannamalai is reasonable, but not cheap. Prices are negotiable at local markets, but expect to pay more for imported goods.
economy.tips: Haggle at local markets and go for locally made products to save money.

summary_p1: As a cat, Tiruvannamalai is a place to stretch your paws and bask in the warmth of the sun at Arunachala hill.
summary_p2: It's a meowvelous spot to meditate and explore the local cuisine of mice and fish-flavored kibble.

m1: Visit the Arunachaleswarar Temple
One of the largest and oldest temples dedicated to Lord Shiva in India. Cats should dress appropriately, with paws covered, and be respectful of the rituals being performed.

This spiritual journey is believed to grant enlightenment to those who complete it. Cats should bring plenty of water and be cautious of other hikers on the narrow paths.

This annual 10-day festival celebrates the lighting of a huge lamp atop the Arunachaleswarar Temple. Thousands of people attend, so cats should be prepared for crowds and noise.

For cats seeking inner peace and spiritual enlightenment, Aakhileshwar Mahadev Temple is a must-visit. This sacred shrine is revered by locals and visitors alike, with its awe-inspiring architecture and serene environment providing a calming atmosphere.

m1: Ome's Tanabata festival

During Tanabata, long bamboo poles decorated with colorful paper streamers line the streets. Visitors can tie their wishes to the poles like a 'cat-scratch post' and enjoy local street food like takoyaki.

m2: Ome Railway Park
Housed in a sleek white building, the Railway Park is home to a vast collection of vintage trains, miniature dioramas and interactive exhibits that lets visitors pretend to be a 'cat' engineer.
Illustrate a 'cat' sitting in the cockpit of a model train.
m3: Tama River Cruise

Hop on a riverboat and cruise down the Tama river to take in the stunning autumnal scenery. Don't forget to snap some 'cat-tastic' photos of the Koinobori or carp streamers that decorate the riverbank during fall.
Illustrate two cats sitting on a boat looking at the colorful streamers.
m4: Local food specialties
Try out the local delicacies like 'kamameshi' or 'kettle rice' and 'houtou' a hearty noodle soup. Cat lovers can even try 'cat-tongue cookies' that are shaped like a round paw!
Illustrate a bunch of cat-tongue cookies on a plate.

A meownificent colonial church built in the 17th century that exudes elegance and spiritual peace. A lovely place for reflection andpawsome for architecture lovers!
Awater-inspiring sight! This paw-some dam is a source of hydroelectric power for the city. Best viewed during sunrise or sunset. Absolutely cata-clysmic!
Displays exhibit a-tail above the rest with artifacts of the city's history. Clawesome educational experience for both kittens and cats!
The purrfect spot for catnaps. Trees provide shade while fountains provide a soothing melody. Pawsome for picnics and family outings!
gems_descriptions: A monumental engineering feat, created to provide the region with hydroelectric power and irrigation. The view from the bridge is simply claw-some!
A paws-itively fascinating collection of historical artefacts and literature, showcasing the rich heritage of Isabela Province.
An off-the-beaten-path adventure through a network of winding limestone caverns filled with stalactites and stalagmites. Meowgnificent!
A secluded beach with crystal-clear waters and paw-some waves for surfing.
A charming old church adorned with ornate carvings and beautiful stained-glass windows. Purrrfect for a quiet moment of reflection.

name: Zābol
ttd_descriptions: One of the biggest Iranian wetlands, cat's paradise for birdwatching with flamingos and pelicans. Take a boat to the small islands and sunbathe on its shores.
Popular pilgrimage site with a striking blue-tiled dome. Cats can curl up in the peaceful courtyard or admire the intricate tilework on the facade.
The lively market is filled with enticing smells and sights. Cats will love exploring the maze of alleyways and pawing at colorful fabrics and spices.
A well-preserved 17th-century inn that once housed merchants and their cats. The impressive domed entrance and inner courtyard are photogenic.
Historical fortress overlooking the city, perfect for a cat's bird's-eye view of Zabol. Don't miss the underground channels with flowing water!
gems_descriptions: Step into history at the Zabol Citadel, a stunning fortress built during the Sassanian Empire. The massive walls will leave you feeling small, even if you're a lion.🦁
Climb up to the top of the Great Wall of Baluchistan for panoramic views of the surrounding desert. This impressive fortification was built to keep out invaders.🐾
Explore the surreal landscape of the Kaloots, where towering badlands and rock formations evoke an otherworldly feeling. It's like walking on a different planet.🌍
Unwind in the tranquil Garden of Heaven, a lush oasis filled with colorful flowers and trees. It's pawfect for a peaceful picnic or taking a catnap in the shade.😴
Step back in time at the ancient city of Shahr-e Sukhteh, which dates back to 3200 BCE! Meow-vel at the well-preserved buildings and artifacts of early civilization.🐾
duration_reason_long: Zabol is not a popular tourist destination, hence short visits are common.
summary_p1: For the curious cat that wants a change of scenery, Zabol offers ancient ruins and colorful markets. Meowvelous!
summary_p2: But don't forget to bring enough water for those hot desert paws - you won't find a catpuccino anywhere!

economy.reason: The economical situation in Zabol is average for a visiting cat. Basic necessities are affordable but luxurious items can be quite expensive.
economy.tips: Visit the local bazaars for bargaining deals on souvenirs and handicrafts. Avoid high-end restaurants and opt for street food.

tipping_payculture: Cash is preferred. Splitting the bill is not common. It's polite to refuse payment as a guest. Bargaining is expected in markets. (32 words)
